description: The Woolworth Building is a 792-foot-tall residential building and early skyscraper at 233 Broadway in the Tribeca neighborhood of Lower Manhattan in New York City.
detail: Woolworth Building’s Grand Arcade Is Once Again a Sight All Can See

description: The Flatiron Building, originally the Fuller Building, is a 22-story, 285-foot-tall steel-framed triangular building at 175 Fifth Avenue in the Flatiron District neighborhood.
detail: End of an Era for the Flatiron Building

description: The Empire State Building is a 102-story Art Deco skyscraper in the Midtown South
detail: Why the Empire State Building, and New York, May Never Be the Same

description: Oriental Poppies, also called Red Poppies, is an oil-on-canvas painting by Georgia O'Keeffe. It is a close-up of two Papaver orientale flowers that fill the entire canvas.
No. 6 (Violet, Green and Red) is a painting by the Latvian-American expressionist artist Mark Rothko.
detail: Mark Rothko at Full Scale, and in Half Light

description: Hope II is an oil-on-canvas painting with added gold and platinum by the Austrian symbolist artist Gustav Klimt, depicting a pregnant woman with closed eyes.
detail: Long-Lost Klimt Painting Sells for $37 Million at Auction

description: Flag is an encaustic painting by the American artist Jasper Johns.
Hot Bottoms by Ken Price watercolor on paper
detail: Ken Price, Sculptor Whose Artworks Helped Elevate Ceramics, Dies at 77.
Keith Haring’s Legacy Is Not Found at the Museum
